Package com.csse3200.game.ui.Hero

package com.csse3200.game.ui.Hero
  • Related Packages
    Package
    Description
    com.csse3200.game.ui
     
    com.csse3200.game.ui.leaderboard
     
    com.csse3200.game.ui.terminal
     
  • Classes
    Class
    Description
    BaseHeroStatusPanelComponent
    Generic base class for the hero status panel (percentage-based positioning/sizing): - Includes: name, HP, energy, damage, level, upgrade cost, and ULT button - Subclasses can override buildExtraSections()/bindExtraListeners() to add custom sections - The panel is placed automatically: directly below the Hotbar → and below the summon toolbar
    DefaultHeroStatusPanelComponent
    Default hero status panel (for Hero1/2/3, etc.) - Adds a “Weapon Switch Cooldown” bar below the basic info - Automatically turns into gray “Locked” state after the hero is upgrade-locked
    EngineerStatusPanelComponent
     
    EngineerSummonToolbarComponent
    Engineer summon toolbar (safe version: zero tint / zero alpha changes / prevents batch color bleed)
    HeroHintDialog
    One-time hint window: shows only the weapon-switch hint and a close button.
    HeroStatsDialog
    Hero stats window: displays level, health, attack, and supports upgrading.
    HeroStatusPanelComponent
    “Hero status card” inside the left yellow panel: - Shows: name, HP, energy, damage, level, upgrade cost, ULT button - Summon system UI: summon capacity (placed/max) + progress bar; cooldown countdown + progress bar Listened events: - hero.hp(Integer cur, Integer max) - hero.energy(Integer cur, Integer max) - hero.damage(Integer dmg) - hero.level(Integer lv) - summonAliveChanged(Integer alive, Integer max) // From EngineerSummonComponent - summon:cooldown(Float remaining, Float total) // From EngineerSummonComponent - upgraded(...) / upgradeFailed(...)
    HeroWeaponSwitcherToolbarComponent
     
    SamuraiAttackToolbarComponent
    Samurai attack toolbar (percentage-based positioning) - Fixed to the right side of the screen, directly below the Hotbar - Three buttons: Iai Slash (1) / Sweeping Slash (2) / Whirlwind Slash (3) - Click to fire hero event "ui:samurai:attack" -> "jab"/"sweep"/"spin"
    SamuraiStatusPanelComponent
    Samurai status panel (no summon section).
